text:
After calling ServerSupportFunction to init a response-header 200 WITH NO 
CONTENT-LENGTH i make successive calls to WriteClient
(connid,block,blocklength,HSE_IO_SYNC) to send blocks of the (long) message-
body. The block-content is known and the blocklength is constant. I exacly send 
blocklength bytes.

What the client gets is: 
  data + CR + LF + "xyz" + CR + LF! 
"xyz" seems to be the length of the block in hex. 

The application works properly under IIS.

Replicable samples: 
blocklength==10 ==> xyz = CR + LF + "a" + CR + LF
blocklength==1024 ==> xyz = CR + LF + "400" + CR + LF
blocklength==1025 ==> xyz = CR + LF + "401" + CR + LF
blocklength==64k ==> xyz = CR + LF + "ffff" + CR + LF

Maybe debug output???
